Yii Framework v2.0.0-dev Class Reference

Class yii\console\controllers\AssetController

All Classes | Properties | Methods | Events
Inheritanceyii\console\controllers\AssetController » yii\console\Controller » yii\base\Controller » yii\base\Component » yii\base\Object
Implementsyii\base\Arrayable, yii\base\ViewContextInterface
Available since version2.0
Source Code
This command allows you to combine and compress your JavaScript and CSS files.

Usage: 1. Create a configuration file using 'template' action: yii asset/template /path/to/myapp/config.php 2. Edit the created config file, adjusting it for your web application needs. 3. Run the 'compress' action, using created config: yii asset /path/to/myapp/config.php /path/to/myapp/config/assets_compressed.php 4. Adjust your web application config to use compressed assets.

Note: in the console environment some path aliases like '@webroot' and '@web' may not exist, so corresponding paths inside the configuration should be specified directly.

Note: by default this command relies on an external tools to perform actual files compression, check $jsCompressor and $cssCompressor for more details.

Property Details

$defaultAction property
string $defaultAction = 'compress'

Controller default action ID.

$bundles property
array $bundles = []

List of asset bundles to be compressed.

$targets property
array $targets = []

List of asset bundles, which represents output compressed files. You can specify the name of the output compressed file using 'css' and 'js' keys: For example:

'app\config\AllAsset' => [
    'js' => 'js/all-{ts}.js',
    'css' => 'css/all-{ts}.css',
    'depends' => [ ... ],
]

File names can contain placeholder "{ts}", which will be filled by current timestamp, while file creation.

$jsCompressor property
string|callback $jsCompressor = 'java -jar compiler.jar --js {from} --js_output_file {to}'

JavaScript file compressor. If a string, it is treated as shell command template, which should contain placeholders {from} - source file name - and {to} - output file name. Otherwise, it is treated as PHP callback, which should perform the compression. Default value relies on usage of "Closure Compiler"

See Also

  • https://developers.google.com/closure/compiler/
$cssCompressor property
string|callback $cssCompressor = 'java -jar yuicompressor.jar {from} -o {to}'

CSS file compressor. If a string, it is treated as shell command template, which should contain placeholders {from} - source file name - and {to} - output file name. Otherwise, it is treated as PHP callback, which should perform the compression. Default value relies on usage of "YUI Compressor"

See Also

  • https://github.com/yui/yuicompressor/
$behaviors property read-only
yii\base\Behavior[] getBehaviors( )

list of behaviors attached to this component

$uniqueId property read-only
string getUniqueId( )

the controller ID that is prefixed with the module ID (if any).

Method Details

getAssetManager() method
yii\web\AssetManager getAssetManager( )
return yii\web\AssetManager asset manager instance.
throws yii\console\Exception on invalid configuration.

Returns the asset manager instance.

setAssetManager() method
void setAssetManager( $assetManager )
$assetManager yii\web\AssetManager|array Asset manager instance or its array configuration.
throws yii\console\Exception on invalid argument type.

Sets asset manager instance or configuration.

actionCompress() method
void actionCompress( $configFile, $bundleFile )
$configFile string Configuration file name.
$bundleFile string Output asset bundles configuration file name.

Combines and compresses the asset files according to the given configuration.

During the process new asset bundle configuration file will be created. You should replace your original asset bundle configuration with this file in order to use compressed files.

loadConfiguration() method
void loadConfiguration( $configFile )
$configFile string Configuration file name.
throws yii\console\Exception on failure.

Applies configuration from the given file to self instance.

loadBundles() method
yii\web\AssetBundle[] loadBundles( $bundles )
$bundles string List of asset bundle names
return yii\web\AssetBundle[] list of source asset bundles.

Creates full list of source asset bundles.

loadDependency() method
void loadDependency( $bundle, &$result )
$bundle yii\web\AssetBundle Bundle instance
$result array Already loaded bundles list.
throws yii\console\Exception on failure.

Loads asset bundle dependencies recursively.

loadTargets() method
yii\web\AssetBundle[] loadTargets( $targets, $bundles )
$targets array Output asset bundles configuration.
$bundles yii\web\AssetBundle[] List of source asset bundles.
return yii\web\AssetBundle[] list of output asset bundles.
throws yii\console\Exception on failure.

Creates full list of output asset bundles.

buildTarget() method
void buildTarget( $target, $type, $bundles, $timestamp )
$target yii\web\AssetBundle Output asset bundle
$type string Either 'js' or 'css'.
$bundles yii\web\AssetBundle[] Source asset bundles.
$timestamp integer Current timestamp.
throws yii\console\Exception on failure.

Builds output asset bundle.

adjustDependency() method
yii\web\AssetBundle[] adjustDependency( $targets, $bundles )
$targets yii\web\AssetBundle[] Output asset bundles.
$bundles yii\web\AssetBundle[] Source asset bundles.
return yii\web\AssetBundle[] output asset bundles.

Adjust dependencies between asset bundles in the way source bundles begin to depend on output ones.

registerBundle() method
void registerBundle( $bundles, $name, &$registered )
$bundles yii\web\AssetBundle[] Asset bundles list.
$name string Bundle name.
$registered array Stores already registered names.
throws yii\console\Exception if circular dependency is detected.

Registers asset bundles including their dependencies.

void saveTargets( $targets, $bundleFile )

$bundleFile string Output file name.
throws yii\console\Exception on failure.
